alert.note: Alert for East Slopes of the Oregon Cascades; Grande Ronde Valley; Northern Blue Mountains of Oregon; Southern Blue Mountains of Oregon; Wallowa County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued June 09 at 2:46PM PDT by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...HEAVY RAINFALL THROUGH SUNDAY WITH RISING STREAMS AND RIVERS... Heavy rain is expected over the Cascades through early Saturday and then across the Blue Mountains and portions of eastern Oregon and Washington Saturday into Sunday. Rainfall amounts of 0.50 to 1.00 inches are expected across the outlook area for lower elevations, with totals in excess 2-3 inches possible for the mountains. Rivers continue to run high across all of southeast Washington and central and northeast Oregon due to the recent wet conditions. Many rivers remain close to or above bankfull and will continue to run fast and high. Campers, hikers and those planning outdoor activities should keep advised of developing showers and seek higher ground, if necessary. Never camp along streams, rivers and creeks. Keep an eye on children and pets to make sure they do not get too close to the water`s edge.

area.areaDesc: East Slopes of the Oregon Cascades; Grande Ronde Valley; Northern Blue Mountains of Oregon; Southern Blue Mountains of Oregon; Wallowa County
